results.title: Recursion - Wikipedia
results.content: Recursion is the process a procedure goes through when one of the steps of the procedure involves invoking the procedure itself. A procedure that goes through recursion is said to be 'recursive'. [3] To understand recursion, one must recognize the distinction between a procedure and the running of a procedure.

results.title: What is Recursion? - W3Schools
results.content: WhatisRecursion? Recursion is when a function calls itself to solve a smaller version of the problem. This continues until the problem becomes small enough that it can be solved directly. That smallest case is called the base case.
